meanings.definition: A book that covers the basic elements of a subject.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a primer to introduce the students to new concepts.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed a primer from the library to learn about gardening.
meanings.sent3: The primer on dinosaurs made learning about them so much fun!
meanings.sent4: Her primer on time management was like a guiding light in the chaos of schedules.
meanings.sent5: The primer on space exploration painted a vivid picture of the universe.

meanings.definition: A substance used as a preparatory coat on a surface before painting.
meanings.sent1: The painter applied a primer to the wall before adding color.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use a primer before painting to ensure better adhesion.
meanings.sent3: The primer smelled like fresh paint and possibilities.
meanings.sent4: The primer acted as a shield, protecting the wall from the paint's effects.
meanings.sent5: The primer created a smooth canvas for the artist's masterpiece.

meanings.definition: An explosive charge used to ignite a larger charge.
meanings.sent1: The soldier carefully placed the primer to set off the explosion.
meanings.sent2: The demolition expert inserted the primer to trigger the blast.
meanings.sent3: The primer sparked excitement among the spectators before the big bang.
meanings.sent4: The primer's tiny flame led to a spectacular fireworks display.
meanings.sent5: The primer's role was crucial in starting the chain reaction.
